Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses challenges with motivation and self-doubt, feeling overwhelmed by project scopes and comparing their art to others, which affects their confidence.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports positive changes in communication and relationships, feeling more present and appreciated by friends. They have made efforts to improve family interactions and have been working on managing feelings of self-doubt.
Physiological Observations: The patient has been maintaining a consistent bedtime and reports waking up feeling refreshed, indicating improvements in sleep quality.
Current Functional Status: The patient notes enhanced communication with friends, leading to more productive discussions and stronger connections.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in relationships and is actively working on self-improvement strategies, such as journaling achievements.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to break down projects into manageable tasks and to keep a journal of accomplishments to combat self-doubt.
Next Steps: The patient plans to continue focusing on motivation and journaling achievements before the next session.
